location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter No. 50 of 1865 from Lewis Pelly, Political Resident in the Persian Gulf, Muscat, to Charles Gonne, Secretary to Government, Political Department, Bombay

mods.abstract: Letter informing the Government in Bombay of his arrival in Muscat (also given as Muskat), his meeting with His Highness' Vezeer [Vizier] and is intention to travel to Burkeh [Barka] in order to meet the Sultan there.The letter also includes Pelly's initial thoughts on the quarrel between Muscat and the Wahabees [Wahhabi] and where the British Government's obligations and interests might lie with regards to the quarrel.The Government's reply No. 3102 of 1865 to this letter can be found on the verso of folio 61
